page.title: 19Third London Airport
page.content: In 1968 an event happened which shook the area - it was shortlisted as a site for the Third London Airport. The site was at R.A.E. Thurleigh. The County Council ensured that District and Parish Councils and the public were aware of the information which was published by the Roskill Commission and also examined the effects an airport at Thurleigh would have on Bedfordshire. All parish councils, the county and district councilsand many voluntary organisations opposed the principle. Barns were painted with the slogan - No Airport at Thurleigh - still visible today. Maplin was chosen in 1971, but in 1974 the project was cancelled by the Labour Government. Now Stansted is to be the new airport.
